head: be
examples: I found a solution, but I found it so fast that it can't be the right solution.
It may be that the happiness awaiting us is not at all the sort of happiness we would want.
Seeing that you're not surprised, I think you must have known.

head: be
examples: If the world weren't in the shape it is now, I could trust anyone.
America is a lovely place to be, if you are here to earn money.
That's because you're a girl.

head: be
examples: I can only wonder if this is the same for everyone else.
If the world weren't in the shape it is now, I could trust anyone.
America is a lovely place to be, if you are here to earn money.

head: be
examples: No I'm not; you are!
I'm not a real fish, I'm just a mere plushy.
It's not much of a surprise, is it?

head: have
examples: I don't know if I have the time.
I don't know if I still have it.
There's no point saying "Hi, how are you?" to me if you have nothing else to say.

head: be
examples: That's because you're a girl.
Every person who is alone is alone because they are afraid of others.
If you don't understand something, it's because you aren't aware of its context.

head: say
examples: They say love is blind.
It is said that "Hamlet" is the most interesting play ever written.
My friends always say I'm too calm, but my family always says I'm too annoying.

head: do
examples: I don't know what to do anymore.
What do you think I've been doing?
And what are we going to do?

head: want
examples: It's because you don't want to be alone.
I once wanted to be an astrophysicist.
I don't want to be lame; I want to be cool!!

head: think
examples: Most people think I'm crazy.
I think it is best not to be impolite.
I don't think, therefore I am not.

head: know
examples: It is inevitable that I go to France someday, I just don't know when.
When you're trying to prove something, it helps to know it's true.
You don't know who I am.

head: ask
examples: If anyone was to ask what the point of the story is, I really don't know.
She's asking how that's possible.
"What's the matter?" asked the little white rabbit.

head: have
examples: I suppose that behind each thing we have to do, there's something we want to do...
Mathematicians are poets, except that they have to prove what their fantasy creates.
The discrepancy between the stories of the two parties involved in the accident was so great that the authorities had a hard time deciding which side was telling the truth.
